---



## Description
Let your viewers take part in an auction where channel points are the currency. Every redemption adds up to their total bidding. After the auctions ends, the highest bidder wins and may receive a reward that you specified. You could for example give them a [VIP role for a month](temporary_vip.md) or add an item to their [user inventory](user_inventory.md) :) The channel points of everyone else except the winner are getting refunded.

![Picture](assets/media/channel_point_auction_title_2.png)

- - - -

## Import Code
```scss

```
- - - -

## Installation

1. Copy the import code from above and import the content

    ![Import Actions](assets/media/import_actions.png)

2. Move to the `Commands` tab and enable the imported commands

    ![How To Enable Commands](assets/media/enable_commands.png)

3. In Streamer.bot, head into `Platforms -> Twitch -> Channel Point Rewards` and create your auction reward. Give it a title you want, the description is getting updated automatically. Make sure `Redemption Skips Queue` stays unchecked.

4. Rightclick the reward and click `Copy Reward ID`.

5. Head back into the `Actions` tab and navigate to the action `[Channel Point Auction] 1 - Settings`. Rightclick the "Test" trigger and hit "Test Trigger". This will open the settings menu. Paste your reward ID into the very top, then save and exit.

  ![Picture](assets/media/channel_point_auction_reward_id.png)

6. Done! 🥳


- - - -

## Settings 

In the `[Channel Point Auction] 1 - Settings` action, you can customize the auction to your liking and also update the chat responses.

![Picture](assets/media/channel_point_auction_settings_1.png)

![Picture](assets/media/channel_point_auction_settings_2.png)

- - - -

## Commands

- ## `!AUCTION`
  {: .no_toc }

  Gives information about the currently active auction (like the redeemer's own bid, the highest bid, etc).
  
- - - -

## Custom Triggers

The extension comes with three custom triggers.

![Picture](assets/media/channel_point_auction_triggers.png)

Available variables:
1. Auction Ended (Winner): `winnerUser`, `winnerUserName`, `winnerUserId`, `winnerBid`
2. Auction Ended (Draw): `winnerUser#`, `winnerUserName#`, `winnerUserId#`, `winnerBid`, `winnerCount` (the user variables are indexed, depending on the winner count, starting with 0).
3. Auction Ended (No Winner): none
  
- - - -
